LNet

The Lustre Networking subsystem. More...

Modules

 Initialization and cleanup
 

The LNet must be properly initialized before any LNet calls can be made.


 LNet addressing and basic types
 

Addressing scheme and basic data types of LNet.


 Match entries
 

A match entry (abbreviated as ME) describes a set of criteria to accept incoming requests.


 Memory descriptors
 

A memory descriptor contains information about a region of a user's memory (either in kernel or user space) and optionally points to an event queue where information about the operations performed on the memory descriptor are recorded.


 Events and event queues
 

Event queues (abbreviated as EQ) are used to log operations performed on local MDs.


 Data movement operations
 

The LNet API provides two data movement operations: LNetPut() and LNetGet().


 Miscellaneous operations.
 

Miscellaneous operations.


Detailed Description

The Lustre Networking subsystem.

LNet is an asynchronous message-passing API, which provides an unreliable connectionless service that can't guarantee any order. It supports OFA IB, TCP/IP, and Cray Portals, and routes between heterogeneous networks.
